info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 6 at 3:23AM CDT until June 7 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible.
* WHERE...A portion of South Central Kansas, including the following county, Kingman.
* WHEN...Through Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...Area creeks and streams are running high and could rise further with more heavy rain. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Another complex of thunderstorms is expected across southern Kansas tonight. Given very wet antecedent conditions, additional heavy rainfall may aggravate ongoing flooding concerns.
info.instruction:
You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING
